i1.name: Love_Tap
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Miss Fortune's''' [[basic attack]]s apply a mark that expires when attacking a new enemy. If the enemy was unmarked, this also deals {{as|{{pp|key=%|50 to 100 for 6|1;4;7 to 13|formula=50% + 10% every 3 levels up to 7, then + 10% every 2 levels up to 13}} AD}} {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}}, halved to {{as|{{pp|key=%|50/2 to 100/2 for 6|1;4;7 to 13|formula=25% + 5% every 3 levels up to 7, then + 5% every 2 levels up to 13}} AD}} against {{tip|minion|minions}}.
i1.descriptionHtml: Innate: Miss Fortune's basic attacks apply a mark that expires when attacking a new enemy. If the enemy was unmarked, this also deals 1;4;7 to 13 ‒ undefined AD bonus physical damage, halved to 1;4;7 to 13 ‒ undefined AD against minions.
i1.notes:
* With {{ii|Runaan's Hurricane}}, ''Love Tap'' only applies to the primary target.
* The bonus damage applies {{sti|life steal|link=true}}.
* The empowered attack will not trigger against [[buildings]].

q1.name: Double_Up
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Miss Fortune''' fires a shot at the target enemy that deals {{as|physical damage}}, which then bounces to hit another enemy behind them. The shot applies {{tip|on-attack}} effects to the first enemy hit, as well as {{tip|on-hit}} effects at 100% effectiveness to both enemies hit.
''Double Up's'' bounce is affected by {{tip|critical strike}} modifiers. If ''Double Up'' kills the primary target, the bounce is guaranteed to {{tip|critically strike}}.
''Double Up's'' bounce prioritizes units directly behind the primary target, and does not require {{tip|sight}} of the enemy.
q1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Miss Fortune fires a shot at the target enemy that deals physical damage, which then bounces to hit another enemy behind them. The shot applies on-attack effects to the first enemy hit, as well as on-hit effects at 100% effectiveness to both enemies hit.
Double Up's bounce is affected by critical strike modifiers. If Double Up kills the primary target, the bounce is guaranteed to critically strike.
Double Up's bounce prioritizes units directly behind the primary target, and does not require sight of the enemy.
q1.notes:
* ''Double Up'' deals {{tip|basic damage}} to both targets, but also triggers spell effects by dealing an additional 0 {{tip|spell damage}}.
* {{tip|Spell shield|Spell shields}} can be used by either target. If it is on the primary target, the spell shield will not prevent the shot from bouncing.
* The second shot follows a priority order on targets within 500 units of the primary one:
*# Enemy or neutral units within a 20º cone.
*# Enemy or neutral units within a 40º cone.
*# Enemy or neutral units within a 110º cone.
*# Enemy or neutral units within {{tt|150|Estimated}} units in a 160º cone.
* ''Double Up's'' cast range adjusts based on '''Miss Fortune's''' {{sti|attack range}}, which can be increased by items such as {{ii|Rapid Firecannon}}.
* The damage of a {{tip|critical strike|critically striking}} second shot is {{ap|20*1.75 to 100*1.75}} {{as|(+ 175% AD)}} {{as|(+ 61.25% AP)}} {{as|physical damage}}, increased to {{ap|20*2.1 to 100*2.1}} {{as|(+ 210% AD)}} {{as|(+ 73.5% AP)}} {{as|physical damage}} by {{iis|Infinity Edge}} bonus critical damage.
* If there is no secondary target, the shot will not bounce and the dud will instead fall to the ground.
** The dud lands on the ground 176 units behind the primary target and has a missile speed of 400 on its way there.
{{Unit-targeted cancel conditions}}

effects.str: • Physical Damage: (+ 100% AD) (+ 35% AP)

w1.name: Strut
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Miss Fortune''' gains {{sti|ms|{{as|25 '''bonus''' movement speed}}}} after 5 seconds without taking non-{{tip|persistent damage|persistent}} damage. This bonus is increased after another 5 seconds, and is granted instantly whenever ''Strut'' is cast or upon [[death|respawning]].
{{sbc|Active:}} '''Miss Fortune''' gains {{sti|as|{{as|'''bonus''' attack speed}}}} for 4 seconds.
Marking a new target with {{ai|Love Tap|Miss Fortune}} reduces ''Strut's'' {{sti|cooldown|link=true}} by {{tt|2 seconds|Affected by ability haste}}.
w1.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Miss Fortune gains 25 bonus movement speed after 5 seconds without taking non-persistent damage. This bonus is increased after another 5 seconds, and is granted instantly whenever Strut is cast or upon death.
Active: Miss Fortune gains bonus attack speed for 4 seconds.
Marking a new target with Miss Fortune's Love Tap reduces Strut's cooldown by 2 seconds.

e1.name: Make_It_Rain
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Miss Fortune''' casts a storm of bullets at the target location that grants {{tip|sight}} of the area for 2 seconds, dealing {{as|magic damage}} and {{tip|slow|slowing}} enemies within every {{fd|0.25}} seconds.
''Make It Rain will cast at max range if cast beyond that.''
e1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Miss Fortune casts a storm of bullets at the target location that grants sight of the area for 2 seconds, dealing magic damage and slowing enemies within every 0.25 seconds.
Make It Rain will cast at max range if cast beyond that.

effects.str:
• Magic Damage Per Tick: (+ 10% AP)
  • Maximum Magic Damage: (+ % AP)
  • Slow: %

r1.name: Bullet_Time
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Miss Fortune''' {{tip|channel|channels}} for up to 3 seconds, firing several waves of bullets in a spread of 6 projectiles per wave in the target direction, with each wave dealing {{as|75% AD}} {{as|(+ 20% AP)}} {{as|physical damage}} to enemies hit.
Each wave can {{tip|critical strike|critically strike}}, dealing {{as|{{critical damage|20}} '''bonus''' physical damage}}.
r1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Miss Fortune channels for up to 3 seconds, firing several waves of bullets in a spread of 6 projectiles per wave in the target direction, with each wave dealing 75% AD (+ 20% AP) physical damage to enemies hit.
Each wave can critically strike, dealing (+ IE 25%) bonus physical damage.
leveling: {{st|Total Waves|{{ap|14 to 18}}|Maximum Total Physical Damage|{{as|{{ap|75*14 to 75*18}}% AD}} {{as|(+ {{ap|20*14 to 20*18}}% AP)}}}} {{st|Wave Interval Time| {{ap|2.85/(14 to 18)|round=4}}}}
r1.notes:
* The damage dealt by each wave of ''Bullet Time'' is calculated when the wave reaches the target.
* '''Miss Fortune''' {{tip|sight|reveals}} herself for {{fd|4.5}} seconds if there is an enemy champion within the area.
* Targets cannot be damaged by more than one projectile per wave.
* The bullet streams that each fire 1 projectile per wave are spead by 6{{degree}} between one another, aiming towards the angles +-3/9/15{{degree}} from '''Miss Fortune's''' facing direction.
* ''Bullet time'' picks 6 locations on the ground 500 units from '''Miss Fortune''' (with the aforementioned angles) at the start of the channel and fires a bullet stream towards each.
** If '''Miss Fortune''' is moved to a new location, these locations will '''not''' update; the cone will fire towards Miss Fortune's original position, thinning down or spreading out based on distance from the group of locations.
* ''Bullet time'' fires the first wave at {{rutngt|0.05}}, and the last at {{rutngt|2.9}}. Times between waves are equally spread between these values.
** '''Miss Fortune''' may cancel the last ~{{fd|0.1}} seconds of channel time at no loss of effect.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Miss Fortune''' is {{tip|channel|channeling}}:
{{ct|channel|attack=interrupts|cast=interrupts|move=interrupts|items=interrupts,true,,false|consume=true|spells=true,interrupts,interrupts,interrupts,interrupts}}
